The Phoenix Hits 200th Issue!

The Phoenix is a weekly 32-page comic for children aged 6 – 12 and features seven or more exciting story strips, a puzzle competition and a new non-fiction strip every week of the year. On Friday 30 October the Phoenix is celebrating its 200th issue; the first independent UK comic since 1969 to do so!

The cover for the 200th issue has been designed by current Children’s Laureate Chris Riddell. You can get involved by tweeting #HappyPhoenix200 to spread the word!

The Phoenix is a really great comic with loads of fun characters. You can read a free online copy of a past issue here.

Some of the comic strips are published as collections and Suffolk Libraries has the following available:

Corpse Talk: Intrepid interviewer, Adam Murphy, draws himself digging up and interviewing unusual and interesting dead famous people.

Baggage: The tale of Randall, a disaster-prone lost property officer, who must locate the owner of the oldest item stored in the immense lost property warehouse by the end of the day. If not, he loses his job!

Bunny vs Monkey: The British Space Agency have sent a monkey into space! But all does not go well with the flight, and Monkey’s spaceship only just about clears the first hilltop before crash-landing in a peaceful forest. Thinking he is on a new planet, Monkey decides to claim it for his own.

Activities to try:

There is a brilliant activities section on the Phoenix website packed with competitions and creative stuff for kids to do. They also encourage kids to send their own comics in for them to read! You can learn to draw my favourite character Evil Emperor Penguin (and his minion Eugene) here on the Guardian website.

Would you like to see the comic in Suffolk Libraries? Read the free online issue and let us know what you think in the comments below.

    About

    My name is Matt Shenton and I am working for Suffolk Libraries as a dedicated ‘Literacy Ambassador’ for the next year. My role is to work with schools, statutory and voluntary organisations and other interested parties to promote reading for pleasure and the importance of literacy to young people and their families in Suffolk.
